articles.title: Swedish Birthday Wishes for Your Partner: Sweet Messages That Touch the Heart
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Your partner's fÃ¶delsedag is the perfect opportunity to show your love in Swedish. Whether you're writing a heartfelt card, planning a Ã¶verraskning fest, or simply want to make them feel speciell, these phrases will help you express your feelings beautifully.

For more ways to express affection, check out our guide on [Swedish compliments for your partner](/blog/en/swedish-compliments-for-your-partner).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen"
  translation="Happy Birthday"
  pronunciation="grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen"
  context="The essential greeting for your partner's special day."
/>

## Essential Birthday Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="fÃ¶delsedag"
  translation="birthday"
  pronunciation="fÃ¶delsedag"
  example="Today is your fÃ¶delsedag!"
/>

| Swedish | English | Usage |
|---|---|---|
| fÃ¶delsedag | birthday | The special day |
| grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen | happy birthday | The greeting |
| Ã¶nskan | wish | Birthday desires |
| fira | celebrate | To honor the day |
| present | gift | Birthday present |
| tÃ¥rta | cake | Birthday tradition |
| ljus | candles | On the cake |
| fest | party | Celebration |
| Ã¶verraskning | surprise | Unexpected joy |
| speciell | special | Extraordinary |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª" title="Swedish Birthday Traditions">
In Swedish-speaking cultures, birthdays often include singing traditional songs, making wishes while blowing out ljus, and sharing tÃ¥rta with loved ones. The person celebrating may also be expected to bring treats for others.
</CultureTip>

## Sweet Birthday Messages

### Simple Wishes
- **grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen, my love!** - Classic and heartfelt
- **Wishing you all the best!** - Traditional well-wishes
- **May all your Ã¶nskanes come true!** - Magical sentiment

### Romantic Messages
- **You make my life speciell** - Expressing gratitude
- **Every day with you is a present** - Love declaration
- **You are the best Ã¶verraskning in my life** - Romantic twist

<VocabCard
  word="speciell"
  translation="special"
  pronunciation="speciell"
  example="You are so speciell to me."
/>

## Birthday Card Messages

### Heartfelt Short Messages
**"grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen to the most speciell person in my world!"**

**"On your fÃ¶delsedag, I want you to know how much you mean to me."**

### Longer Romantic Messages
**"Every fÃ¶delsedag I get to fira with you is a blessing. You make my life complete. grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen, my love!"**

**"Another year of loving you is my greatest present. May this fÃ¶delsedag bring you all the joy you deserve."**

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª" title="Birthday Gift Etiquette">
In Swedish-speaking cultures, presents are usually opened immediately when received. It's customary to express genuine enthusiasm and gratitude. Practical and thoughtful presents are often valued over extravagant ones.
</CultureTip>

## Planning the Perfect Birthday

### Party Vocabulary
| Swedish | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| fest | party | The celebration |
| Ã¶verraskning | surprise | Unexpected party |
| tÃ¥rta | cake | Birthday tradition |
| ljus | candles | For wishes |
| present | gift | Birthday present |
| fira | celebrate | To party |

### Surprise Party Phrases
- **Ã¶verraskning!** - When they walk in
- **We're here to fira!** - Explaining the party
- **Make a Ã¶nskan!** - Before blowing candles

## Birthday Morning Messages

Start their day with love:

| Time | Message | Translation |
|---|---|---|
| Morning | grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen! Wake up, love! | Birthday greeting |
| Midday | Thinking of you on your speciell day | Sweet check-in |
| Evening | Ready to fira? | Party time |

## Singing Happy Birthday

Learn to sing the fÃ¶delsedag song in Swedish! This is one of the most touching ways to honor your partner's culture on their speciell day.

<VocabCard
  word="Ã¶nskan"
  translation="wish"
  pronunciation="Ã¶nskan"
  example="Make a Ã¶nskan!"
/>

## Birthday Milestone Messages

### 30th Birthday
**"Welcome to your thirties! The best fÃ¶delsedag for the best partner!"**

### 40th Birthday
**"Forty years of amazing you! Here's to firaing many more!"**

### 50th Birthday
**"Half a century of wonderful you! You only get more speciell with time."**

For more romantic vocabulary, explore our [Swedish romantic phrases](/blog/en/swedish-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion) guide.

## Quick Reference Card

| Purpose | Say This |
|---|---|
| Greeting | grattis pÃ¥ fÃ¶delsedagen! |
| Toast | To your speciell day! |
| Before cake | Make a Ã¶nskan! |
| All day | You are so speciell! |

Making your partner feel loved on their fÃ¶delsedag in their native Swedish creates memories that last a lifetime. Every word spoken with love becomes a present in itself.

<CTA />

articles.title: Phrases de rÃ©confort en anglais : Soutenir son partenaire
articles.content:
## Soutenir son partenaire en anglais

Savoir rÃ©conforter son partenaire dans les moments difficiles est essentiel. Ces phrases vous aideront Ã  exprimer votre soutien en anglais.

## Phrases de rÃ©confort de base

### "I'm here for you"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯m HIER for you

**Signification :** Je suis lÃ  pour toi

Simple mais puissant - montre votre prÃ©sence.

### "Everything is going to be okay"
**Prononciation :** Ã‰-vri-thing iz GO-ing tou bi o-KEÃ

**Signification :** Tout va bien se passer

### "You're not alone in this"
**Prononciation :** yor not a-LON in zis

**Signification :** Tu n'es pas seul(e) dans cette Ã©preuve

## Ã‰couter et valider

### "I understand how you feel"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯ eun-der-STAND haou you fil

**Signification :** Je comprends ce que tu ressens

### "It's okay to feel this way"
**Prononciation :** its o-KEÃ tou fil zis oueÃ¯

**Signification :** C'est normal de ressentir Ã§a

### "Your feelings are valid"
**Prononciation :** yor FI-lingz ar VA-lid

**Signification :** Tes sentiments sont lÃ©gitimes

## Offrir du soutien actif

### "What can I do to help?"
**Prononciation :** ouot kan aÃ¯ DOU tou help

**Signification :** Que puis-je faire pour t'aider ?

### "I'm always here to listen"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯m OL-oueÃ¯z hier tou LI-sen

**Signification :** Je suis toujours lÃ  pour t'Ã©couter

### "Take all the time you need"
**Prononciation :** teÃ¯k ol ze taÃ¯m you nid

**Signification :** Prends tout le temps dont tu as besoin

## Encouragement

### "You're stronger than you think"
**Prononciation :** yor STRON-guer zan you think

**Signification :** Tu es plus fort(e) que tu ne le penses

### "I believe in you"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯ bi-LIV in you

**Signification :** Je crois en toi

### "You've got this"
**Prononciation :** youv GOT zis

**Signification :** Tu vas y arriver

## Moments difficiles

### "I'm so sorry you're going through this"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯m so SO-ri yor GO-ing zrou zis

**Signification :** Je suis vraiment dÃ©solÃ©(e) que tu traverses Ã§a

### "Let me hold you"
**Prononciation :** let mi HOLD you

**Signification :** Laisse-moi te prendre dans mes bras

### "We'll get through this together"
**Prononciation :** ouil guet zrou zis tou-GUÃ‰-zer

**Signification :** On va traverser Ã§a ensemble

## Deuil et perte

### "I'm here for you during this difficult time"
**Prononciation :** aÃ¯m hier for you DU-ring zis DI-fi-keult taÃ¯m

**Signification :** Je suis lÃ  pour toi pendant cette pÃ©riode difficile

### "There are no words, but I'm here"
**Prononciation :** zÃ¨r ar no ouerdz beut aÃ¯m hier

**Signification :** Il n'y a pas de mots, mais je suis lÃ 

## AnxiÃ©tÃ© et stress

### "Let's breathe together"
**Prononciation :** lets BRIZ tou-GUÃ‰-zer

**Signification :** Respirons ensemble

### "Focus on one thing at a time"
**Prononciation :** FO-keus on ouan thing at a taÃ¯m

**Signification :** Concentre-toi sur une chose Ã  la fois

### "You don't have to face this alone"
**Prononciation :** you dont hav tou feÃ¯s zis a-LON

**Signification :** Tu n'as pas Ã  affronter Ã§a seul(e)

## Conseils pour le soutien Ã©motionnel

**Ã‰coute active :** Parfois, Ãªtre lÃ  suffit.

**Ã‰vitez de minimiser :** "Ce n'est pas si grave" peut blesser.

**Contact physique :** Un cÃ¢lin peut valoir mille mots.

**Patience :** Chacun guÃ©rit Ã  son rythme.

**Actions concrÃ¨tes :** PrÃ©parez un repas, faites une corvÃ©e.

## Conclusion

Le soutien Ã©motionnel est une pierre angulaire de toute relation. Ces phrases vous aideront Ã  montrer Ã  votre partenaire anglophone que vous Ãªtes lÃ , dans les bons et les mauvais moments.

articles.title: Vocabular pentru BebeluÈ™i È™i SarcinÄƒ Ã®n EnglezÄƒ: Expresii EsenÈ›iale
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

AÈ™teptarea unui copil este unul dintre cele mai emoÈ›ionante momente din viaÈ›a unui cuplu. Acest ghid te va ajuta sÄƒ Ã®nveÈ›i vocabularul esenÈ›ial pentru a comunica despre sarcinÄƒ È™i bebeluÈ™i.

Pentru mai multe expresii pentru cupluri, consultÄƒ [expresii esenÈ›iale pentru cupluri](/learn/ro/en/en-essential-phrases-for-couples).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Suntem Ã®nsÄƒrcinaÈ›i!"
  translation="We're expecting!"
  pronunciation="vestea cea mare"
  context="AnunÈ›ul care schimbÄƒ totul."
/>

## Vocabular de BazÄƒ

<VocabCard
  word="sarcinÄƒ"
  translation="pregnancy"
  pronunciation="gestaÈ›ie"
  example="Sarcina decurge bine."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="bebeluÈ™"
  translation="baby"
  pronunciation="copil mic"
  example="AÈ™teptÄƒm un bebeluÈ™!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ã®nsÄƒrcinatÄƒ"
  translation="pregnant"
  pronunciation="Ã®n aÈ™teptare"
  example="Sunt Ã®nsÄƒrcinatÄƒ!"
/>

### Termeni EsenÈ›iali

| RomÃ¢nÄƒ | EnglezÄƒ | Context |
|--------|---------|--------|
| sarcinÄƒ | pregnancy | Starea de a aÈ™tepta un copil |
| trimestru | trimester | Perioada de 3 luni |
| naÈ™tere | birth/delivery | Momentul naÈ™terii |
| moaÈ™Äƒ | midwife | Specialist Ã®n naÈ™teri |
| ginecolog | gynecologist | Doctor specialist |
| ecografie | ultrasound | InvestigaÈ›ie imagisticÄƒ |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‘¶" title="AnunÈ›area Sarcinii">
Modul Ã®n care cuplurile anunÈ›Äƒ sarcina variazÄƒ Ã®ntre culturi. Unii preferÄƒ sÄƒ aÈ™tepte primul trimestru, alÈ›ii anunÈ›Äƒ imediat. Ãn unele culturi, existÄƒ superstiÈ›ii despre cÃ¢nd È™i cum sÄƒ faci anunÈ›ul.
</CultureTip>

## AnunÈ›area Sarcinii

### Expresii pentru AnunÈ›
- **Vom deveni pÄƒrinÈ›i!** - We're going to be parents!
- **Familia noastrÄƒ creÈ™te!** - Our family is growing!
- **AÈ™teptÄƒm un copilaÈ™!** - We're expecting a baby!
- **Vom fi trei!** - We're becoming three!
- **Cea mai mare surprizÄƒ!** - The biggest surprise!

<VocabCard
  word="Vom deveni pÄƒrinÈ›i!"
  translation="We're going to be parents!"
  pronunciation="anunÈ› emoÈ›ionant"
  example="Avem veÈ™ti minunate - vom deveni pÄƒrinÈ›i!"
/>

### AnunÈ›uri Creative
| MetodÄƒ | Descriere |
|--------|----------|
| Ecografie | PosteazÄƒ prima imagine |
| Pantofior | Trei perechi de pantofi |
| AnunÈ› de familie | Cu animalul de companie |
| SurprizÄƒ la cinÄƒ | Pentru pÄƒrinÈ›i È™i bunici |

## Vocabular Medical

### Termeni pentru ConsultaÈ›ii
| Termen | SemnificaÈ›ie |
|--------|-------------|
| ConsultaÈ›ie prenatalÄƒ | VizitÄƒ la doctor |
| Ecografie morfologicÄƒ | Verificare detaliatÄƒ |
| Analize de sÃ¢nge | Teste de laborator |
| Data probabilÄƒ de naÈ™tere | CÃ¢nd se aÈ™teaptÄƒ bebeluÈ™ul |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ¥" title="Sistemul Medical">
Sistemele medicale variazÄƒ Ã®ntre È›Äƒri. Ãn unele locuri, moaÈ™ele sunt principale, Ã®n altele ginecologii. FamiliarizeazÄƒ-te cu sistemul din È›ara partenerului tÄƒu pentru o experienÈ›Äƒ mai bunÄƒ.
</CultureTip>

## EvoluÈ›ia Sarcinii

### Primul Trimestru (SÄƒptÄƒmÃ¢nile 1-12)
- **Simptome de dimineaÈ›Äƒ** - greaÈ›Äƒ, obosealÄƒ
- **Prima ecografie** - confirmarea sarcinii
- **Formarea organelor** - moment critic

### Al Doilea Trimestru (SÄƒptÄƒmÃ¢nile 13-26)
- **MiÈ™cÄƒrile bebeluÈ™ului** - primele semnale
- **Aflarea sexului** - dacÄƒ se doreÈ™te
- **Energia revine** - perioada "de aur"

### Al Treilea Trimestru (SÄƒptÄƒmÃ¢nile 27-40)
- **PregÄƒtirea pentru naÈ™tere** - cursuri, camera bebeluÈ™ului
- **ContracÈ›ii** - semne ale naÈ™terii apropiate
- **Nesting** - instinctul de pregÄƒtire

<VocabCard
  word="Data probabilÄƒ de naÈ™tere"
  translation="Due date"
  pronunciation="estimare"
  example="Data probabilÄƒ de naÈ™tere este Ã®n martie."
/>

## PregÄƒtirea pentru BebeluÈ™

### Obiecte EsenÈ›iale
| Obiect | Utilizare |
|--------|----------|
| PÄƒtuÈ› | Pentru somn |
| Scutece | IgienÄƒ |
| CÄƒruÈ› | Transport |
| Scaun auto | SiguranÈ›Äƒ |
| Biberoane | HrÄƒnire |
| Body-uri | ÃmbrÄƒcÄƒminte |

### Camera BebeluÈ™ului
- **PÄƒtuÈ› sigur** - fÄƒrÄƒ perne moi
- **Monitorizare** - video sau audio
- **SchimbÄƒtor** - cu tot necesarul
- **Dulap** - pentru hÄƒinuÈ›e

## Expresii de Felicitare

### Pentru AnunÈ›
- **FelicitÄƒri! Ce veste minunatÄƒ!**
- **Sunt atÃ¢t de fericit/Äƒ pentru voi!**
- **VeÈ›i fi pÄƒrinÈ›i minunaÈ›i!**
- **Ce bucurie!**

### Pentru NaÈ™tere
- **FelicitÄƒri pentru nou-nÄƒscut!**
- **Bine ai venit pe lume, micuÈ›ule/micuÈ›o!**
- **Ce bebeluÈ™ frumos!**
- **MamÄƒ È™i tatÄƒ fericiÈ›i!**

<VocabCard
  word="FelicitÄƒri pentru nou-nÄƒscut!"
  translation="Congratulations on the new baby!"
  pronunciation="urare de naÈ™tere"
  example="FelicitÄƒri! BebeluÈ™ul este adorabil!"
/>

## TradiÈ›ii È™i SuperstiÈ›ii

### SuperstiÈ›ii Comune
| CredinÈ›Äƒ | Origine |
|----------|--------|
| Nu cumpÄƒra nimic Ã®nainte | ProtecÈ›ie |
| Nu spune sexul | SurprizÄƒ |
| RoÈ™u pentru protecÈ›ie | TradiÈ›ionalÄƒ |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ€" title="Baby Shower">
Baby shower-ul este o petrecere pentru viitoarea mamÄƒ, popularÄƒ Ã®n SUA È™i acum È™i Ã®n Europa. InvitaÈ›ii aduc cadouri pentru bebeluÈ™, se joacÄƒ jocuri tematice È™i se celebreazÄƒ momentul.
</CultureTip>

## Sfaturi pentru Viitori PÄƒrinÈ›i

1. **ComunicÄƒ** - vorbeÈ™te cu partenerul despre aÈ™teptÄƒri
2. **InformeazÄƒ-te** - citeÈ™te, participÄƒ la cursuri
3. **PregÄƒteÈ™te-te emoÈ›ional** - schimbÄƒri mari vin
4. **Cere ajutor** - de la familie È™i prieteni
5. **BucurÄƒ-te** - este o perioadÄƒ specialÄƒ

<CTA />

## Concluzie

AÈ™teptarea unui copil este o cÄƒlÄƒtorie minunatÄƒ. Cu acest vocabular, vei fi pregÄƒtit sÄƒ navighezi aceastÄƒ perioadÄƒ specialÄƒ È™i sÄƒ comunici eficient cu medicii, familia È™i partenerul tÄƒu.

FelicitÄƒri È™i multÄƒ sÄƒnÄƒtate!

articles.title: 50 Swedish Compliments for Your Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Swedes may have a reputation for being reserved, but when it comes to expressing love, they have a wonderfully warm vocabulary. Learning to compliment your Swedish partner in their native language will create a special connection.

## The Most Beautiful Compliment

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Du ar fantastisk"
  translation="You are fantastic"
  pronunciation="doo air fan-TAS-tisk"
  context="A heartfelt compliment that Swedes love to hear. It conveys genuine admiration and appreciation."
/>

In Swedish culture, sincere and understated compliments are valued over excessive flattery. When you compliment someone genuinely, it means the world to them.

## Complimenting Appearance

### For Women

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar vacker"
  translation="You are beautiful"
  pronunciation="doo air VAK-er"
  example="Du ar sa vacker idag!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar underbar"
  translation="You are wonderful"
  pronunciation="doo air OON-der-bar"
  example="Du ar verkligen underbar!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar bedÃ¥rande"
  translation="You are enchanting"
  pronunciation="doo air be-DOH-ran-de"
  example="Din leende ar bedÃ¥rande."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar strÃ¥lande"
  translation="You are radiant"
  pronunciation="doo air STROH-lan-de"
  example="Du ar strÃ¥lande ikvÃ¤ll!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar fantastisk"
  translation="You are fantastic"
  pronunciation="doo air fan-TAS-tisk"
  example="Du ar helt fantastisk!"
/>

### For Men

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar snygg"
  translation="You are handsome/good-looking"
  pronunciation="doo air snooyg"
  example="Du ar riktigt snygg!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar attraktiv"
  translation="You are attractive"
  pronunciation="doo air at-trak-TEEV"
  example="Du ar en attraktiv man."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar stark"
  translation="You are strong"
  pronunciation="doo air stark"
  example="Du ar sa stark!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar elegant"
  translation="You are elegant"
  pronunciation="doo air e-le-GANT"
  example="Du ser elegant ut ikvÃ¤ll!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Swedish Modesty" flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª">
Swedes often follow "Jantelagen" - a cultural code promoting humility. Don't be surprised if your partner downplays compliments. Keep giving them anyway - they're deeply appreciated, even if the response seems modest!
</CultureTip>

## Complimenting Specific Features

### Eyes

<VocabCard
  word="Du har vackra Ã¶gon"
  translation="You have beautiful eyes"
  pronunciation="doo har VAK-ra UH-gon"
  example="Du har sa vackra Ã¶gon!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag drunknar i dina Ã¶gon"
  translation="I'm drowning in your eyes"
  pronunciation="yah DROON-knar ee DEE-na UH-gon"
  example="A deeply romantic expression."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dina Ã¶gon lyser som stjÃ¤rnor"
  translation="Your eyes shine like stars"
  pronunciation="DEE-na UH-gon LOO-ser som SHARE-nor"
  example="Romantic and poetic!"
/>

### Smile

<VocabCard
  word="Du har ett vackert leende"
  translation="You have a beautiful smile"
  pronunciation="doo har ett VAK-ert LE-en-de"
  example="Ditt leende lyser upp rummet."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar vacker nar du ler"
  translation="You're beautiful when you smile"
  pronunciation="doo air VAK-er nair doo lair"
  example="Express your affection."
/>

### Voice

<VocabCard
  word="Du har en vacker rÃ¶st"
  translation="You have a beautiful voice"
  pronunciation="doo har en VAK-er rust"
  example="Jag Ã¤lskar att hÃ¶ra dig prata."
/>

## Personality Compliments

### Kindness and Character

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar snÃ¤ll"
  translation="You are kind"
  pronunciation="doo air snell"
  example="Du ar sa snÃ¤ll mot alla."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar omtÃ¤nksam"
  translation="You are caring/thoughtful"
  pronunciation="doo air om-TENK-sam"
  example="Du ar en omtÃ¤nksam partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar kÃ¤rleksfull"
  translation="You are loving"
  pronunciation="doo air SHARE-leks-full"
  example="Du ar sa kÃ¤rleksfull."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du har ett hjÃ¤rta av guld"
  translation="You have a heart of gold"
  pronunciation="doo har ett YAIR-ta av goold"
  example="A beautiful expression of admiration."
/>

### Intelligence and Talent

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar smart"
  translation="You are smart"
  pronunciation="doo air smart"
  example="Du ar sa smart!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar begÃ¥vad"
  translation="You are talented"
  pronunciation="doo air be-GOH-vad"
  example="Du ar otroligt begÃ¥vad!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar genial"
  translation="You are a genius"
  pronunciation="doo air ye-ni-AL"
  example="Den idÃ©n ar genial, precis som du!"
/>

### Humor and Fun

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar rolig"
  translation="You are funny"
  pronunciation="doo air ROO-li"
  example="Du ar sa rolig!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det ar kul att vara med dig"
  translation="It's fun being with you"
  pronunciation="det air kool at VA-ra med dey"
  example="Det ar alltid kul med dig!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Swedish Directness" flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª">
Swedes value honesty and directness. A simple, genuine compliment often means more than elaborate praise. When you say something nice, your Swedish partner knows you truly mean it.
</CultureTip>

## Romantic Compliments

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar min lycka"
  translation="You are my happiness"
  pronunciation="doo air min LOO-ka"
  example="Du ar all min lycka."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du gÃ¶r mig lycklig"
  translation="You make me happy"
  pronunciation="doo yur mey LOOK-li"
  example="Varje dag gÃ¶r du mig lycklig."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar det bÃ¤sta som hÃ¤nt mig"
  translation="You're the best thing that's happened to me"
  pronunciation="doo air det BES-ta som hent mey"
  example="The ultimate romantic compliment."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag ar stolt Ã¶ver dig"
  translation="I'm proud of you"
  pronunciation="yah air stolt UH-ver dey"
  example="Jag ar sa stolt Ã¶ver dig!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Med dig kÃ¤nner jag mig speciell"
  translation="With you I feel special"
  pronunciation="med dey SHEN-er yah mey spe-si-ELL"
  example="Express how they make you feel."
/>

## Complimenting Actions and Efforts

<VocabCard
  word="Du lagar mat himmelskt"
  translation="You cook heavenly"
  pronunciation="doo LA-gar mat HIM-elskt"
  example="Maten ar himmelsk!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du gÃ¶r allting perfekt"
  translation="You do everything perfectly"
  pronunciation="doo yur AL-ting per-FEKT"
  example="Admire their efforts."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag gillar hur du gÃ¶r det"
  translation="I like how you do it"
  pronunciation="yah YIL-lar hoor doo yur det"
  example="Acknowledge their unique way."
/>

## Poetic Comparisons

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar vacker som en ros"
  translation="You're beautiful like a rose"
  pronunciation="doo air VAK-er som en roos"
  example="Classic romantic comparison."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du lyser som solen"
  translation="You shine like the sun"
  pronunciation="doo LOO-ser som SOO-len"
  example="You brighten everything."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du ar som en Ã¤ngel"
  translation="You're like an angel"
  pronunciation="doo air som en ENG-el"
  example="Du ar min Ã¤ngel!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Fika and Compliments" flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª">
Swedes bond over "fika" - coffee and pastry breaks. Sharing a fika with your partner is a perfect time for gentle compliments. The relaxed atmosphere makes heartfelt words feel natural.
</CultureTip>

## Responding to Compliments

When your partner compliments you, here's how to respond:

| Swedish | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| Tack | tak | Thank you |
| Du ocksa | doo OK-so | You too |
| Du smickrar mig | doo SMIK-rar mey | You flatter me |
| Verkligen? | VERK-li-gen | Really? |
| Du ar sa sÃ¶t | doo air so sut | You're so sweet |
| Det ar snÃ¤llt sagt | det air snellt sagt | That's nice to say |

## Daily Compliments to Use

Make it a habit to compliment your partner daily:

| Situation | Swedish | English |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| Morning | Du ser bra ut | You look good |
| After cooking | Jattegott! | Very delicious! |
| Getting dressed | Det klÃ¤r dig | It suits you |
| Working hard | Du ar duktig | You're good/capable |
| Being supportive | Tack fÃ¶r att du finns | Thanks for being you |
| Before bed | Jag har tur som har dig | I'm lucky to have you |

## Quick Reference: Essential Compliments

### For Her

| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du ar vacker | You're beautiful |
| Du ar underbar | You're wonderful |
| Du ar bedÃ¥rande | You're enchanting |
| Du ar smart | You're smart |
| Du ar snÃ¤ll | You're kind |

### For Him

| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du ar snygg | You're handsome |
| Du ar stark | You're strong |
| Du ar manlig | You're manly |
| Du ar smart | You're smart |
| Du ar snÃ¤ll | You're kind |

### Universal

| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du ar speciell | You're special |
| Jag ar stolt Ã¶ver dig | I'm proud of you |
| Du ar allt fÃ¶r mig | You're my everything |
| Det ar skÃ¶nt med dig | It's good with you |
| Du ar bÃ¤st | You're the best |

<CTA
  text="Ready to master these compliments? With Love Languages, your partner can send you Word Gifts with compliments in authentic AI voice. Practice with AI voice chat until you're confident. Your partner becomes your tutor!"
  buttonText="Start Learning Svenska"
/>

articles.title: Tyrkiske fraser til forsoning og genopbygning af tillid
articles.content:
Tyrkisk kultur lÃ¦gger stor vÃ¦gt pÃ¥ Ã¦re og respekt. At kunne forsone sig pÃ¥ tyrkisk krÃ¦ver, at du viser bÃ¥de ydmyghed og oprigtig kÃ¦rlighed til din partner.

## Forsoning pÃ¥ tyrkisk

I tyrkisk kultur er det Ã¦refuldt at kunne indrÃ¸mme fejl og bede om tilgivelse. Din partner vil respektere din evne til at tage ansvar.

## Fraser til forsoning

### At undskylde oprigtigt

<Phrase>
  <Original>GerÃ§ekten Ã§ok Ã¶zÃ¼r dilerim</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg undskylder virkelig meget</Translation>
  <Context>En dybtfÃ¸lt undskyldning.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Gehr-chek-ten chok Ã¶-zÃ¼r dee-leh-reem</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Seni incitmek istememiÅŸtim</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg ville ikke sÃ¥re dig</Translation>
  <Context>Forklar at skaden ikke var tilsigtet.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Seh-nee een-jeet-mek ees-teh-meh-meesh-teem</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>HatalÄ±ydÄ±m ve bunu kabul ediyorum</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg tog fejl, og jeg accepterer det</Translation>
  <Context>Tag ansvar for din fejl.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Hah-tah-lih-dihm veh boo-noo kah-bool eh-dee-yoh-room</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

### At genopbygge forbindelsen

<Phrase>
  <Original>Yeniden baÅŸlayabilir miyiz?</Original>
  <Translation>Kan vi starte forfra?</Translation>
  <Context>Bed om en ny begyndelse.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Yeh-nee-den bahsh-lah-yah-bee-leer mee-yeez</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Kavga ettiÄŸimizde nefret ediyorum</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg hader, nÃ¥r vi skÃ¦ndes</Translation>
  <Context>Udtryk dit ubehag ved konflikten.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Kahv-gah et-tee-ee-meez-deh nef-ret eh-dee-yoh-room</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Sen benim iÃ§in her ÅŸeysin</Original>
  <Translation>Du er alt for mig</Translation>
  <Context>BekrÃ¦ft din partners betydning.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Sen beh-neem ee-cheen hehr shey-seen</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

### At tilbyde forsoning

<Phrase>
  <Original>Bunu telafi etmeme izin ver</Original>
  <Translation>Lad mig gÃ¸re det godt igen</Translation>
  <Context>Tilbyd at kompensere for fejlen.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Boo-noo teh-lah-fee et-meh-meh ee-zeen vehr</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Bunu dÃ¼zeltmek iÃ§in ne yapabilirim?</Original>
  <Translation>Hvad kan jeg gÃ¸re for at ordne det?</Translation>
  <Context>Vis villighed til at handle.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Boo-noo dÃ¼-zelt-mek ee-cheen neh yah-pah-bee-lee-reem</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>SÃ¶z veriyorum, deÄŸiÅŸeceÄŸim</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg lover, at jeg vil Ã¦ndre mig</Translation>
  <Context>Giv et lÃ¸fte om forbedring.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>SÃ¶z veh-ree-yoh-room deh-ee-sheh-jeh-eem</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

### At acceptere en undskyldning

<Phrase>
  <Original>Seni affediyorum</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg tilgiver dig</Translation>
  <Context>Giv tilgivelse.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Seh-nee ahf-feh-dee-yoh-room</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Bunu geride bÄ±rakalÄ±m</Original>
  <Translation>Lad os lÃ¦gge det bag os</Translation>
  <Context>Signal om at gÃ¥ fremad.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Boo-noo geh-ree-deh bih-rah-kah-lihm</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Ne olursa olsun seni seviyorum</Original>
  <Translation>Jeg elsker dig, uanset hvad der sker</Translation>
  <Context>BekrÃ¦ft kÃ¦rligheden.</Context>
  <Pronunciation>Neh oh-loor-sah ol-soon seh-nee seh-vee-yoh-room</Pronunciation>
</Phrase>

## Kulturelle tips

1. **Ã†re** - at undskylde ses som Ã¦refuldt, ikke svagt
2. **Familie** - respektÃ©r familiens rolle i jeres liv
3. **GÃ¦stfrihed** - te eller kaffe kan vÃ¦re en del af forsoningen
4. **Tid** - giv din partner tid til at acceptere undskyldningen

Med disse fraser kan du forsone dig pÃ¥ tyrkisk med den respekt og oprigtighed, kulturen vÃ¦rdsÃ¦tter.
